radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild dependent atelectasis is noted at the lung bases bilaterally. The appendix is abnormal with dilation up to 10 mm with thickened enhancing wall, no evidence of perforation. Enhancing regional lymph nodes in the right lower quadrant are likely reactive. Several small hypodensities in the abdomen, with the largest near the gallbladder fossa, too small to accurately characterize. No retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy. Kidneys enhance symmetrically and excrete contrast promptly. No suspicious bony lesions.
